intro: Cynorkis tamponensis, commonly known as the Tampón orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-white or pale yellow blooms that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in sunny, well-drained environments and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
